intro: Psychotria cordatula, commonly known as the heart-shaped Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It is often found in understory layers of tropical forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Psychotria cordatula is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine.
